alert.note: Alert for Montezuma (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 4:36PM MDT until July 28 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Colorado, including the following counties, La Plata and Montezuma. * WHEN...Until 745 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 436 PM MDT, satellite imagery and lightning frequency indicate heavy rain from thunderstorms in the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Durango, Breen, Kline, Marvel, Redmesa, Hesperus, Bondad and Falfa.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
